page.title: 05Feeding cattle in winter.
page.content:
{Making silage.}
On Somerby Grove Farm they use silage to feed the cattle in winter. Mr.Laming told us how to make silage. He cuts the grass twice a year in the summer with a machine that looks like a big lawnmower. This is pulled along behind a tractor. When he has collected the grass he puts it in the silage pit. This is like a big box with three walls and no roof made from railway sleepers. Then he covers it with sheets of plastic and puts tyres on top to keep it air-tight. In the winter he lets the cows out of the cattle shed to eat the silage.
